title: Grant Denyer fuels rumours he's on The Masked Singer
text:
Rumours are swirling that Grant Denyer could be on The Masked Singer.

And the Channel 10 presenter fueled speculation on Friday, when he told The Daily Telegraph he has been learning to sing.

The Game of Games host, 42, revealed he has been taking singing lessons weekly for the past few years.

Speculation: Grant Denyer fueled rumours he's a contestant on The Masked Singer by revealing on Friday he is taking regular singing lessons. Pictured on Game of Games

'I have no idea why, I just wanted to learn a new skill or a new craft,' Denyer said.

'I like music. I play guitar and I play the drums. I love the art of singing, it is the most incredible craft and it is so impressive when you watch someone that can do it well.

'I just wanted to have a go and see where it took me. I have no idea what I am doing.'

Start your engines! Fans of The Masked Singer are convinced Grant is 'the Dragon' (pictured), due to the various clues alluding to race car driving

Grant's singing teacher, Lindsay Field, is a well-known producer and long-term member of the John Farnham Band.

Meanwhile, fans of The Masked Singer are convinced that Grant is 'the Dragon', due to the various clues alluding to race car driving.

Grant is a former V8 Supercar driver.

New role: On Thursday, it was announced Grant will host a summer radio show on the Hit Network alongside former Gogglebox star Yvie Jones (right, with Angie Kent)

On Thursday, it was announced Grant will host a summer radio show on the Hit Network alongside former Gogglebox star Yvie Jones.

He told Now To Love that he was thrilled about the short-term project.



'I'm still working with SCA and we've got some great projects coming up over summer, which is fantastic because I love radio,' he said.

Grant previously hosted 2Day FM's Sydney breakfast show alongside Ed Kavalee and Ash London before it was cancelled in August.
description: The Game of Games host, 42, revealed he has been taking singing lessons weekly for the past few years
authors: David Wu For Daily Mail Australia
